Floral Basket to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Basket to Kim Jong Il 
    Pyongyang, September 4 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il received a floral basket from the Chinese government on his reelection as chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK at the First Session of the 11th DPRK Supreme People's Assembly.
 Chinese Ambassador E.P. to the DPRK Wu Donghe conveyed the basket to an official concerned on Sept. 3.

Preparatory Committee Formed by Koreans in Far Eastern Region
articles.content:
Preparatory Committee Formed by Koreans in Far Eastern Region 
    Pyongyang, September 4 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee of the United Confederation of Koreans in the Far Eastern Region was inaugurated on Sept. 1 with due ceremony to celebrate the 55th anniversary of the DPRK.
 Kwon Chon Sik, chairman of the confederation, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.    
 The committee discussed and decided on the plan to hold multifarious functions including celebration meeting, seminar and film show on the occasion.

articles.title: Congratulations to Kim Jong Il from Jiang Zemin
articles.content:
Congratulations to Kim Jong Il from Jiang Zemin 
    Pyongyang, September 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, received a congratulatory message from Jiang Zemin, chairman of the Central Military Commission of the People's Republic of China, on Sept. 3 on his reelection as chairman of the National Defence Commission of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea at the First Session of the 11th Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK.
 The message said that the traditional friendship between China and the DPRK has made steady good progress in recent years and expressed belief that the Sino-Korean friendly and cooperative relations would surely grow stronger thanks to the joint efforts of both sides.    
 Hoping for the progress and prosperity of the DPRK, the message wished Kim Jong Il greater success in his future work.

articles.title: Worldwide Signature Campaign for Peace of Korea Held
articles.content:
Worldwide Signature Campaign for Peace of Korea Held 
    Pyongyang, September 4 (KCNA) -- The Australian Peace Committee and the Australia-Friend on the Earth started a signature campaign in June after sending letters to heads of state of various countries and the U.S. president opposing the U.S. plan to mount a military attack on the DPRK and calling on the U.S. to faithfully fulfil its commitment to nuclear disarmament under the NPT, conclude a non-aggression treaty with the DPRK and peacefully solve the nuclear issue.
 In response to the appeal, the signature campaign has been held worldwide for the past 3 months. 
 It was signed by at least 400 organizations of more than 50 countries including the Australian Medical Science Association for Preventing War, the Russian Doctors' Organization for Preventing Nuclear War, the Canadian Doctors' Organization for the Existence of the Earth, the Indian Institute for Peace, Disarmament and Environmental Protection, the Sri Lankan Journalists Federation and the Brazilian Peace Council and over 30 international and regional organizations including Abolition-2000 which has at least 2,000 affiliated organizations in the world, the International Doctors' Organization for Preventing Nuclear War, the World Peace Council, the Hague Office for Peace, the World Citizens' Association and the Arab Human Rights Committee.    
 84 organizations including the Lawyers' Committee on the Nuclear Policy and the U.S. Peace Council supported the signature campaign in the U.S. and the mayor of Hiroshima,    
Japan, who is chairman of the Mayors' Organization for Peace signed the signature paper on behalf of mayors of 547 cities of 107 countries.
 Nearly 60 members of parliaments of 13 countries including Russia, Britain, Ghana, Tanzania and Brazil took part in the signature campaign.

Young Koreans in Japan Called Upon to Disclose Japan's Crimes
articles.content:
Young Koreans in Japan Called Upon to Disclose Japan's Crimes
    Tokyo, September 2 (KNS-KCNA) -- The Federation of Young Korean Traders and Industrialists in Japan, the Korean Youth League in Japan and the Union of Korean Students in Japan issued a joint appeal to the Korean youth and students in Japan on August 31, 80 years after the massacre of Koreans during the Kanto quake of 1923.
 The bestial nature and national chauvinism of the Japanese reactionaries have not changed at all, although 80 years have passed since the massacre of Koreans during the quake, the appeal said, assailing the Japanese reactionaries for threatening the life and property of Koreans in Japan and creating a terror-ridden atmosphere reminding one of the incident during the quake.    
 The appeal called on the youth and students, descendents of the first generation of Koreans in Japan, to turn out as one in a struggle to disclose the crimes committed by the Japanese imperialists in the past so as to vent the bitter grudge of the Koreans in Japan of the preceding generations and bring genuine happiness and future to the Koreans in Japan.

articles.title: DPRK Has Bright Future
DPRK Delegation Leaves for New Delhi
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation Leaves for New Delhi
    Pyongyang, September 4 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Ministry of Public Health led by Vice-Minister Choe Chang Sik left Pyongyang today to participate in the 21st meeting of health ministers in Southeast Asia of the World Health Organization to be held in New Delhi, India.
 It was seen off at the airport by Vice-Minister of Public Health Jon Hyon Phung.

articles.title: Greetings to Emir of Qatar
articles.content:
Greetings to Emir of Qatar
    Pyongyang, September 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on September 2 sent a message of greetings to Hamad bin Khalifa al-Thani, emir of Qatar, on the occasion of the 32nd anniversary of its independence.
 The message expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Qatar would continue to develop on good terms in keeping with the desire and interests of the peoples of the two countries, and sincerely wished the emir good health and happiness and the friendly people of Qatar greater progress, prosperity and well-being.

articles.title: Floral Basket to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Floral Basket to Kim Jong Il
    Pyongyang, September 4 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il received a floral basket from Colonel Moammer El Gaddafi, leader of the Great September First Revolution of the Great Socialist People's Libyan Arab Jamahiriya, on the occasion of the 55th anniversary of the DPRK.
 The floral basket was handed today  to an official concerned by Ahmed Amer Al Muakkaf, secretary of the People's Bureau of Libya here.
